Class SimpleGrid

  • java.lang.Object
    • SimpleGrid

  • public class SimpleGrid
extends java.lang.Object

    THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM, OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE SOFTWARE.

    This class allows for the creation, management, and display of a simple 2D graphical grid.

    Each grid box can be set to contain a single integer value. These values can be mapped to color, text, and text color, which are then drawn in any box containing the corresponding value.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleGrid

        public SimpleGrid(int width,
                  int height,
                  int cellSize,
                  int gridlineWeight,
                  java.lang.String name)
        Create a new window containing a blank grid. The window will be automatically sized to fit the grid and will be positioned in the center of the screen.

        By default, all cells will have a value of 0 and the gridlines will be colored black. By default, 0 will also be mapped to have no text, black text color, and "null" cell color. This cell color will appear white on the default grid layer (layer 0) and transparent on higher layers. It is not recommended you change this color, since then lower layers may not be visible.

        Parameters:
        width - The width of the grid in cells.
        height - The height of the grid in cells.
        cellSize - The size of each cell in pixels.
        gridlineWeight - The width of the gridlines in pixels.
        name - The window's name.

      • isOOB

        public boolean isOOB(java.awt.Point pos)
        Returns whether the given coordinates are out-of-bounds of the grid.
        Parameters:
        pos - The coordinates to check.
        Returns:
        True if the given coordinates are out-of-bounds of the grid or if the position is null, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        isOOB(int, int)

        Parameters:

        y - The y-coordinate to check.
        Returns:
        True if the given coordinates are out-of-bounds of the grid, false otherwise.
        See Also:

      • getMousePosition

        public java.awt.Point getMousePosition()
        Returns the grid position of the mouse cursor.
        Returns:
        The xy-coordinates of the cell the mouse cursor is currently over. If the mouse is out-of-bounds or over gridlines, returns null instead.

      • isMouseDown

        public boolean isMouseDown()
        Returns whether the mouse is currently down.
        Returns:
        True if the mouse is currently down, false if the mouse is up.

      • addLayer

        public void addLayer()
        Creates a new grid layer on top of all others. All cells in this layer will have value 0.
        Since:
        v1.1

      • setAutoRepaint

        public void setAutoRepaint(boolean autoRepaint)
        Set whether to automatically repaint after a change is made. By default, auto repainting is enabled.
        Parameters:
        autoRepaint - Whether to automatically repaint after the grid or its settings change.
        Since:
        v1.1
        See Also:
        repaint()

      • repaint

        Repaints the grid.
        Since:

      • set

        public void set(java.awt.Point pos,
                int value)
        Set the cell at the given coordinates to a value. Sets the cell of the default grid (layer 0).
        Parameters:
        pos - The coordinates of the cell to set. If null, the grid will not be changed.
        value - The value to set the cell to.
        See Also:
        set(int, int, int), set(int, Point, int)

      • set

        public void set(int x,
                int y,
                int value)
        Set the cell at the given coordinates to a value. Sets the cell of the default grid (layer 0). This is equivalent to calling set(0, Point, int).
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the cell to set.
        y - The y-coordinate of the cell to set.
        value - The value to set the cell to.
        See Also:
        set(Point, int), set(int, int, int, int)

      • set

        public void set(int layer,
                int x,
                int y,
                int value)
        Set the cell at the given coordinates to a value. Repaints grid if auto repainting is enabled.
        Parameters:
        layer - The layer of the cell to set. If not a valid layer, the grid will not be changed.

        y - The y-coordinate of the cell to set.
        value - The value to set the cell to.

      • fill

        public void fill(int value)
        Fills the grid with a value, setting all cells in the grid to the value. Fills the default grid (layer 0). Repaints grid if auto repainting is enabled. This is equivalent to calling fill(0, int).
        Parameters:
        value - The value to set all the cells in the grid to.
        Since:
        1.2.3
        See Also:
        setAutoRepaint(boolean)

      • fill

        public void fill(int layer,
                 int value)
        Fills the grid with a value, setting all cells in the grid to the value. Repaints grid if auto repainting is enabled.
        Parameters:
        layer - The grid layer to fill. If not a valid layer, the grid will not be changed.
        value - The value to set all the cells in the grid layer to.
        Since:
        1.2.3
        See Also:
        setAutoRepaint(boolean)

      • replace

        public void replace(int currentValue,
                    int newValue)
        Replaces all cells of a given value with cells of a new value. Repaints the grid if auto repainting is enabled.
        Parameters:
        currentValue - The value to be replaced.
        newValue - The value to set all cells of the current value to.
        Since:
        v1.2.5
        See Also:
        setAutoRepaint(boolean)

      • replace

        public void replace(int layer,
                    int currentValue,
                    int newValue)
        Replaces all cells of a given value with cells of a new value. Repaints the grid if auto repainting is enabled.
        Parameters:
        layer - The grid layer to replace on. If not a valid layer, the grid will not be changed.
        currentValue - The value to be replaced.
        newValue - The value to set all cells of the current value to.
        Since:
        v1.2.5
        See Also:
        setAutoRepaint(boolean)

        public void fillRow(int row,
                    int value)
        Fills the given row with a value, setting all cells in the row to the value. Repaints grid if auto repainting is enabled. This is equivalent to calling fillRow(0, int).
        Parameters:

        value - The value to set all the cells in the row to.
        Since:
        1.2.4
        See Also:
        setAutoRepaint(boolean)

      • get

        public int get(java.awt.Point pos)
        Returns the value of the cell at the given coordinates. Gets the cell of the default grid (layer 0). This is equivalent to calling get(0, Point).
        Parameters:
        pos - The coordinates of the cell to get.
        Returns:
        The value of the cell. If the given position is null, returns -1.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the given position is null.
        See Also:
        get(int, int), get(int, Point)

      • get

        public int get(int x,
               int y)
        Returns the value of the cell at the given coordinates. Gets the cell of the default grid (layer 0). This is equivalent to calling get(0, int, int).
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the cell to get.
        y - The y-coordinate of the cell to get.
        Returns:
        The value of the cell.
        See Also:
        get(Point), get(int, int, int)

      • setGridlineColor

        public void setGridlineColor(java.awt.Color color)
        Set the color of the gridlines. Repaints grid if auto repainting is enabled.
        Parameters:
        color - The color to set the gridlines to.
        See Also:
        setAutoRepaint(boolean)

      • setColor

        public void setColor(int value,
                     java.awt.Color color)
        Assigns a color to a given value. All cells with this value will be colored this color. Repaints grid if auto repainting is enabled.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to set the color of.
        color - The color to be assigned to the value. If null, the cell color will white if the cell is on layer 0, otherwise the cell color will be transparent.
        See Also:
        setAutoRepaint(boolean)

      • setTextColor

        public void setTextColor(int value,
                         java.awt.Color textColor)
        Assigns a text color to a given value. All cells with this value will be colored this color. Repaints grid if auto repainting is enabled.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to set the text color of.
        textColor - The text color to be assigned to the value.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the given Color is null.
        Since:
        v1.2
        See Also:
        setAutoRepaint(boolean)

      • setText

        public void setText(int value,
                    char text)
        Assigns a text character to a given value. All cells with this value will display this character. Repaints grid if auto repainting is enabled.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to set the text of.
        text - The text character to be assigned to the value. If '\0', cells with this value will display nothing.
        Since:
        v1.2
        See Also:
        setAutoRepaint(boolean)
